title: US Marine’s adoption of Afghan war orphan voided
description: The rare ruling is the latest twist in an ongoing legal battle between Afghan and US couples for three-year-old girl.

title: Biden tours Mississippi tornado wreckage as more storms threaten US
description: Visit comes as another powerful spring storm sweeps across US South and Midwest, threatening further extreme weather.

title: IMF board approves $15.6bn Ukraine loan package
description: Loan is part of a broader $115bn international support package to help the country meet urgent funding needs.

title: How much of a threat is artificial intelligence?
description: Elon Musk and many other tech experts call for a six-month pause on AI systems.

title: Pope Francis expected to leave hospital on Saturday
description: The Vatican said the 86-year-old pontiff had a pizza and baptised a baby after recovering from a bout of bronchitis.

title: Colombia raises threat level for deadly Nevado del Ruiz volcano
description: Authorities report a spike in seismic activity, including rock fracturing and earthquakes, around the snow-capped peak.

title: California to phase out diesel truck use in bid for cleaner air
description: California will require nearly half of all heavy truck sales to be electric by 2035 as the state aims to cut emissions.

title: Tunisia to cut water supplies to citizens overnight amid drought
description: The drought-hit country announced other tight restrictions on water usage as it braces for another baking summer.

title: Spanish PM urges China’s Xi to speak with Ukraine’s Zelenskyy
description: Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez praises parts of China's 12-point proposal to end the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: NY prosecutor slams ‘baseless’ claim Trump charges are political
description: Manhattan district attorney's office reiterates that Republicans in Congress have no right to intervene in a local case.

title: Canada approves multibillion-dollar Rogers-Shaw telecoms deal
description: Massive takeover deal, first struck in 2021, faced challenges from Canada's antitrust agency and consumer advocates.

title: Wimbledon lifts ban on Russian and Belarusian tennis players
description: Players from both countries will be able to compete as 'neutral' athletes if they meet certain conditions.

title: Palestine advocates see opportunity in Biden-Netanyahu discord
description: Washington's criticism of Israel not about Palestinians but can lead to questioning of US-Israel ties, analysts say.

title: Stampede at food distribution centre kills 11 in Pakistan

title: Ex-England cricket captain Vaughan cleared of racism charge

description: Pistorius, popularly known as 'The Blade Runner', became world famous at the 2012 Olympics, a year before the trial.

title: Why is Sweden left behind in the Nordic NATO bid?

title: Palestinians in Gaza condemn Israeli occupation on Land Day
description: Hundreds take part in annual commemorative event demonstrating Palestinian commitment to resisting Israeli occupation.

title: Crew members missing after Gulf of Guinea pirate attack
description: The hijacked ship has been found abandoned, but an unknown number of its crew is still missing.

title: Reactions to Donald Trump’s indictment
description: The charges come as Trump seeks the Republican nomination to run again in 2024.

title: ‘Born out of hatred’: New Uganda bill terrifies LGBTQ community
description: The proposed bill to criminalise identifying as LGBTQ is already making life harder for sexual minorities in Uganda.

title: Alarm after Taliban arrests girls’ school activist amid crackdown
description: Matiullah Wesa, an advocate for girls' education, is arrested as the Taliban cracks down on women's rights activists.

title: Ramadan recipe: Fateem’s kibbe shines, even in a Syrian IDP camp
description: The mother of 14 prepares a trio of dishes that are essential for her family's Ramadan table.

title: US education: The endless burden of deliberate ignorance
description: The Republican attacks on so-called 'woke education' are adding to the existing burdens on university lecturers like me.

title: How an interview with a rapist fired up Serbia’s feminists
description: A controversial article sparked street demonstrations in Belgrade, which mobilised women to fight for bigger change.

title: ‘World did nothing’ after Russia annexed Crimea: Nobel laureate
description: Chief of Ukraine’s Center for Civil Liberties says international law needs to help Ukraine now, rather than post-war.

description: Chief of Ukraine’s Center for Civil Liberties says international law needs to help Ukraine now, rather than post-war.

title: Yanis Varoufakis on why we should ‘let the banks burn’

title: North Korea executes people for sharing S Korean media: Report

title: Australia says ‘deep concerns’ over journalist detained in China
description: Chinese-Australian Cheng Lei has yet to receive a verdict after more than two and a half years in detention.

description: Authorities say they are waiting for the results of post-mortem and toxicology tests to determine the causes of death.
